| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 281](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L281)       |

A **rabid dog**, d, is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a small [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A rabid has a [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") bite that is [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution")-draining, similar to a [rabid rat](/wiki/Rabid_rat "Rabid rat"), and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"). In Hack'EM, rabid dogs cannot be tamed.

Eating a rabid dog [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") *does not* convey [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster") as with [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") canine corpses, but the corpse is poisonous to eat.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly generated rabid dogs are always created [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").

Rabid dogs appear among the random d that are part of the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Samurai quest](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest").

## Strategy

Rabid dogs are one of many early monsters in both variants that provide a nasty surprise for the uninitiated: while technically weaker than a regular [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog"), it moves just as fast at 16 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"), and their poisonous bite has the same damage as that of the [large dog](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Rabies](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rabies "wikipedia:Rabies")***

Rabies is a viral disease that causes encephalitis (inflammation of the brain) in humans and other mammals, and was historically referred to as hydrophobia or "fear of water", due to the symptom of panic when presented with liquids to drink. Other symptoms include fever and abnormal sensations at the site of exposure early on; these are followed by nausea, vomiting, violent movements, uncontrolled excitement, an inability to move parts of the body, confusion, and loss of consciousness. Once symptoms appear, the result is virtually always death, regardless of treatment.

Symptoms usually appear 1-3 months after contracting the disease, with variance from less than one week to more than one year depending on the distance the virus must travel to reach the central nervous system. Rabies is caused by [lyssaviruses](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/lyssavirus "wikipedia:lyssavirus"), including the rabies virus and Australian bat lyssavirus, and is spread by infected animals to other animals or humans via bite, scratch, or saliva that comes into contact with the eyes, mouth, or nose. Infected dogs are the most common source of rabies cases globally, with the Americas being a relative exception where bat bites are the most common source.

## Encyclopedia entry

A domestic animal, the \_tame dog\_ (\_Canis familiaris\_), of  
which numerous breeds exist. The male is called a dog,  
while the female is called a bitch. Because of its known  
loyalty to man and gentleness with children, it is the  
world's most popular domestic animal. It can easily be  
trained to perform various tasks.

Difficulty 4
Attacks

Bite 2d4 poisonous (constitution)

Base level 3
Base experience 16
Speed 16
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 200
Nutritional value 150
Size Small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed None

A rabid dog:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • wanders randomly.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 281

A rabid dog, d, is a monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a small carnivorous canine that can be seen via infravision.

A rabid has a poisonous bite that is constitution-draining, similar to a rabid rat, and possesses poison resistance. In Hack'EM, rabid dogs cannot be tamed.

Eating a rabid dog corpse or tin does not convey aggravate monster as with domestic canine corpses, but the corpse is poisonous to eat.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Randomly generated rabid dogs are always created hostile.

Rabid dogs appear among the random d that are part of the first quest monster class for Samurai and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Samurai quest.

Strategy

Rabid dogs are one of many early monsters in both variants that provide a nasty surprise for the uninitiated: while technically weaker than a regular dog, it moves just as fast at 16 speed, and their poisonous bite has the same damage as that of the large dog.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Rabies

Rabies is a viral disease that causes encephalitis (inflammation of the brain) in humans and other mammals, and was historically referred to as hydrophobia or "fear of water", due to the symptom of panic when presented with liquids to drink. Other symptoms include fever and abnormal sensations at the site of exposure early on; these are followed by nausea, vomiting, violent movements, uncontrolled excitement, an inability to move parts of the body, confusion, and loss of consciousness. Once symptoms appear, the result is virtually always death, regardless of treatment.

Symptoms usually appear 1-3 months after contracting the disease, with variance from less than one week to more than one year depending on the distance the virus must travel to reach the central nervous system. Rabies is caused by lyssaviruses, including the rabies virus and Australian bat lyssavirus, and is spread by infected animals to other animals or humans via bite, scratch, or saliva that comes into contact with the eyes, mouth, or nose. Infected dogs are the most common source of rabies cases globally, with the Americas being a relative exception where bat bites are the most common source.

Encyclopedia entry

A domestic animal, the _tame dog_ (_Canis familiaris_), of
which numerous breeds exist. The male is called a dog,
while the female is called a bitch. Because of its known
loyalty to man and gentleness with children, it is the
world's most popular domestic animal. It can easily be
trained to perform various tasks.

A '''rabid dog''', {{gray|d}}, is a [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a small [[carnivorous]] [[canine]] that can be seen via [[infravision]].

A rabid has a [[poisonous]] bite that is [[constitution]]-draining, similar to a [[rabid rat]], and possesses [[poison resistance]]. In Hack'EM, rabid dogs cannot be tamed.

Eating a rabid dog [[corpse]] or [[tin]] ''does not'' convey [[aggravate monster]] as with [[domestic]] canine corpses, but the corpse is poisonous to eat.

==Generation==
Randomly generated rabid dogs are always created [[hostile]].

Rabid dogs appear among the random {{white|d}} that are part of the first [[quest]] monster class for [[Samurai]] and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Samurai quest]].

==Strategy==
Rabid dogs are one of many early monsters in both variants that provide a nasty surprise for the uninitiated: while technically weaker than a regular [[dog]], it moves just as fast at 16 [[speed]], and their poisonous bite has the same damage as that of the [[large dog]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Rabies}}
Rabies is a viral disease that causes encephalitis (inflammation of the brain) in humans and other mammals, and was historically referred to as hydrophobia or "fear of water", due to the symptom of panic when presented with liquids to drink. Other symptoms include fever and abnormal sensations at the site of exposure early on; these are followed by nausea, vomiting, violent movements, uncontrolled excitement, an inability to move parts of the body, confusion, and loss of consciousness. Once symptoms appear, the result is virtually always death, regardless of treatment.

Symptoms usually appear 1-3 months after contracting the disease, with variance from less than one week to more than one year depending on the distance the virus must travel to reach the central nervous system. Rabies is caused by [[Wikipedia:lyssavirus|lyssaviruses]], including the rabies virus and Australian bat lyssavirus, and is spread by infected animals to other animals or humans via bite, scratch, or saliva that comes into contact with the eyes, mouth, or nose. Infected dogs are the most common source of rabies cases globally, with the Americas being a relative exception where bat bites are the most common source.
